ci_support_linux_64_libboost_devel1.85nu:
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '13'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
libboost_devel:
- '1.85'
liblapack:
- 3.9.* *netlib
libnetcdf:
- 4.9.2
numpy:
- '1.22'
openblas:
- 0.3.*
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - python
  - numpy
zlib:
- '1'

about.description:
LOOS is a C++ library for developing new tools to analyze molecular
dynamics simulations. It is designed to provide good performance while
greatly simplifying the process of creating new methods, particularly when
using its python interface. This package contains roughly 100 useful tools,
as well as the python bindings needed to create new tools. If you wish to
write a new C++ tool or modify the library itself, we recommend you instead
clone LOOS from GitHub.
about.summary: The Lightweight Object Oriented Structure analysis Library

name: loos

about.description:
LOOS is a C++ library for developing new tools to analyze molecular
dynamics simulations. It is designed to provide good performance while
greatly simplifying the process of creating new methods, particularly when
using its python interface. This package contains roughly 100 useful tools,
as well as the python bindings needed to create new tools. If you wish to
write a new C++ tool or modify the library itself, we recommend you instead
clone LOOS from GitHub.
about.summary: The Lightweight Object Oriented Structure analysis Library

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "loos" %}
{% set version = "4.2.0.1" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}


source:
  url: https://github.com/GrossfieldLab/loos/archive/refs/tags/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 53a064130fa5dfb84a9e593fd20dc782f2007daacf149220c8acf89c8177dad7

build:
  skip: true  # [win]
  number: 3

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}
    - cmake
    - make
    - swig
    - python
  host:
    - python
    - pip
    - numpy
    - libboost-devel
    - openblas
    - libnetcdf
    - liblapack
    - eigen
    - gemmi
    - zlib
    - setuptools
    
  run:
    - python
    - numpy >=1.26
    - scipy
    - scikit-learn
    - gemmi

test:
  requires:
    - pip
  imports:
    - loos
    - loos.pyloos
    - loos.pyloos.trajectories
    - loos.OptimalMembraneGenerator
    - loos.Voronoi
  commands:
    - pip check
    - loos_version

about:
  home: https://github.com/GrossfieldLab/loos
  summary: 'The Lightweight Object Oriented Structure analysis Library'
  description: |
    LOOS is a C++ library for developing new tools to analyze molecular
    dynamics simulations. It is designed to provide good performance while
    greatly simplifying the process of creating new methods, particularly when
    using its python interface. This package contains roughly 100 useful tools,
    as well as the python bindings needed to create new tools. If you wish to 
    write a new C++ tool or modify the library itself, we recommend you instead 
    clone LOOS from GitHub.
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file: COPYING
  doc_url: https://grossfieldlab.github.io/loos
  dev_url: https://github.com/GrossfieldLab/loos

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - agrossfield
    - tromo
